thread.title: Thomas Cook moves capacity away from Tunisia
thread.title_full: Thomas Cook moves capacity away from Tunisia

title: Thomas Cook moves capacity away from Tunisia
text:
Thomas Cook has added extra last-minute holidays to Spain, Portugal, Turkey and Bulgaria for this summer season as it shifts capacity away from Tunisia. Thomas Cook is adding holidays to places like Bulgaria this summer. 
The move is designed to offer more choice to holidaymakers who want to go somewhere other than Tunisia. 
Extra holidays have been put on to destinations including Bulgaria, which has a similar price-point to the North African country. 
Following last month’s terrorist attacks on a beach near Sousse, which killed 38 people, Cook is allowing booking alterations for the duration of the summer season. 
Prices for a seven-night Airtours half-board holiday to Kaptan in Antalya, Turkey, start from £529 per person. 
Thomas Cook is offering seven nights at the four-star Sentido Lanzarote Aequora from £740pp half-board. 
While Signature from Thomas Cook has one week all-inclusive at the five-star Bahia Principe Costa Adeje in Tenerife from £666pp. 
“With the school holidays just around the corner, these fantastic breaks offer great value and near guaranteed sun for those looking to travel to Turkey, the Algarve, Spain and Bulgaria,” said Cook. 
According to analysts at Morgan Stanley, Tunisia represents around 3% of Cook’s summer volumes.
